definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: And why do we fall for it, year after year?
sentences.chinese: 而我們又爲什麼年復一年爲之傾倒？

sentences.english: Rattled by the rats foot only, year to year.
sentences.chinese: 被耗子的腳撥來撥去的，年復一年。

sentences.english: The old farmer works in the fields year in and year out.
sentences.chinese: 那位老農年復一年在地裏勞動。

sentences.english: We heard it at home hundreds of times, one year after another.
sentences.chinese: 我們在家裏年復一年的聽了成百上千次這個故事。

sentences.english: Thesame old favourites recur year in year out with monotonous regularity.
sentences.chinese: 一些相同的老嗜好年復一年地以單調的規律重現。

sentences.english: Nothing will contribute more to that than an extended re-litigation of the last eight years.
sentences.chinese: 過去8年，年復一年的漫長紛爭只會使之雪上加霜。

sentences.english: But year by year there are still more people in need of government support.
sentences.chinese: 但年復一年，還是有更多的人需要政府的援助。

sentences.english: It’s better than having children year after year.
sentences.chinese: 這樣比年復一年地生孩子更好。

sentences.english: Run, and you'll live… at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: Do you really want to battle your dark side year after year?
sentences.chinese: 你真地想年復一年去和你的陰暗面作鬥爭嗎？

sentences.english: For years I pulled my own existence out of emptiness.
sentences.chinese: 年復一年我從空無中拉出自己的存在。

sentences.english: I do not want these childish discussions year after year.
sentences.chinese: 我不想年復一年地討論這種幼稚的事情。

sentences.english: You don't have to listen year after year to the same monologues.
sentences.chinese: 你不必年復一年地聽同樣的獨白。

sentences.english: Run, and you will live at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: This is the annual revolution of the earth around the sun and the time periods are the same as the outer circle.
sentences.chinese: 外圈的圓就和地球圍繞太陽年復一年的旋轉週期一致。

sentences.english: We need to be careful and save a little bit of water for years and years.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要留意和節省一點點水年復一年。

definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to accumulate over a long period of time
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
